channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trip on paving stone, 6th February
item.description:
Where I tripped was on Green Lanes where the bus stop is named as North Circular Rosd. This is by TFC heading towards Wood Green. It by Schmidt.”, the kitchen showroom. I think that is the council responsibility. I believe that the confusion is because the bus stop is named North Circular Road. If you Like, I can provide photos of the location
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 203, Green Lanes, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sinking, 6th February
item.description:
Around the manhole here the road is ‘sinking’ and causing a huge dip in the road. The surface of road is cracking too.

item.title: Two potholes in road on west heath road approaching whitestone pond, 6th February
item.description:
The are two potholes here, so that you cannot avoid going down one of them. In the dark and rain I couldn't see the one on the left and my car made such a bang that I thought I had hit something, the hole is enormous and very dangerous. It was there a couple of months ago, then filled but obviously not successfully.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish/Litter/Food dumped in park by stairs next to theatre, 6th February

item.title: Mattress dumped, 6th February
item.description:
Mattress dumped (again) by the illegal HMO in Anerley Court. This is the 4/5th bedframe and mattress dumped by this flat in the last few months. Always on the pavement/outside Anerley Court. Looks to have been dumped Thursday night when I took the picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: A series of potholes approaching the bend, 6th February
item.description:
There is a series of potholes as you approach the slight bend coming from Lodge Lane end. These are getting progressively worse and pose a danger to those on motorcycles especially during the dark winter months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lodge Lane, Little Thurrock, Grays
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned on pavement outside 174 Maple Road SE20 8JB, 6th February
item.description:
A car has been abandoned outside the Salvation Army Charity Shop on Maple Road on the pavement. The car is unlocked and has a spare tyre on its back seat. The Charity Shop has a sign asking people not to park on this pavement as it affects custom in the shop. Please could you remove this car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 174, Maple Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Little on all verges, 6th February
item.description:
Large amounts of litter on all verges at Darenth Interchange roundabout and the slip road exiting Darenth interchange towards the A2 east (towards Canterbury). Please can this be removed. It has been there for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartford Bypass, Fleet Estate, Dartford

item.title: Abandoned traffic cones left, 6th February
item.description:
